body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky farmer, stockman, and politician. Graduated from Centre College. Moved to Bourbon County, Kentucky to pursue agriculture. Married to Amelia McClanahan Field Clay. Father of Martha Clay, Brutus Junius Clay, Christopher Field Clay, Brutus Junius Clay, Green Clay, Ezekiel Field Clay, and Cassius Marcellus Clay, Jr. to Married to Ann Marie Field Clay. Owned 132 enslaved persons in 1860. Elected as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1840 and 1860. Served as president of the Bourbon County Agricultural Association from 1840 to 1876. Served as president of the Kentucky Agricultural Association from 1853 to 1861. Served the Seventh Congressional District of Kentucky in the United States House of Representative from 1863 to 1865. Served as chair of the Committee on Agriculture in the United States House of Representatives.
